events.title: Mayflower Pilgrims Land at Plymouth Rock
events.description: The Pilgrims aboard the Mayflower landed at what is now Plymouth, Massachusetts, establishing one of the first permanent European settlements in North America.
events.significance: This event marks a foundational moment in American colonial history and is often associated with the roots of the United States.

events.title: Start of Mexico's War of Independence
events.description: Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla gave the 'Grito de Dolores,' a call for rebellion against Spanish rule, initiating Mexico’s fight for independence.
events.significance: Widely celebrated as Mexico’s Independence Day, it symbolizes the beginning of the end of Spanish colonial rule in Mexico.

events.title: Tripartite Pact Signed
events.description: Germany, Italy, and Japan signed the Tripartite Pact, forming the Axis Powers during World War II.
events.significance: This pact formalized the alliance of three major Axis powers, shaping the strategic alliances in World War II.

events.title: The Comoros Gains Independence from France
events.description: The Comoros Islands officially declared independence from French colonial rule.
events.significance: This event marked the end of French colonial rule over the Comoros, contributing to the wave of decolonization in Africa.
